topic.title: Deploying Monitor Service(s) on Dedicated Resource Node(s)

body.p: In HP Helion OpenStack 2.0, monitor service is installed on the controller nodes by default. But you can provide a dedicated resource node(s) as a monitor service(s) by modifying the cloud input model. If you want to deploy monitor service(s) as a standalone node(s) then you must decide prior to the deployment of Ceph. HP Helion OpenStack 2.0 does not support deployment transition. Once Ceph is deployed, you cannot migrate monitor service(s) from controller to standalone node(s).

section.p: The deployer node must be setup before starting Ceph deployment. For more details on the installation of deployer node, refer to installation guide.

p.b: Procedure to install monitor service(s) on a dedicated resource node(s)

body.p:
Perform the following procedure to install monitor on dedicated nodes:
Login to the deployer node.
Ensure that your cloud definition (~/helion/examples/entry-scale-kvm-ceph/*) is placed under ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/ directory.
From server-role: CONTROLLER-ROLE in ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file, remove the line - ceph-monitor. (can i get the sample file??)
Copy the following section in ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file.- name: mon resource-prefix: ceph-mon server-role: MON-ROLE service-components: - ntp-client - ceph-monitorEnsure that the section is correctly indented.
Define the monitor resource
Copy the below definition in ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml file to define all the monitor nodes in the cloud. You must repeat this for each monitor node.- id: mon4 ip-addr: 192.168.10.11 role: MON-ROLE server-group: RACK3 nic-mapping: MY-2PORT-SERVER mac-addr: 8b:f6:9e:ca:3b:7a ilo-ip: 192.168.9.11 ilo-password: password ilo-user: admin Substitute the values in above sample with appropriate values for each of the monitor nodes being added.
Commit your configuration cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>"
Execute the following command:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml
Run the following command, which will reimage all the nodes using PXE.ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml
Run the configuration processor:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Run your "verb_host" commands using the following steps:
cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml
